title.narrative: UNDP RCC Regional Elections Project Phase II 2017-2020
UNDP RCC Regional Elections Project Phase II 2017-2020

description.narrative: The Arab region continues to go through a period of change that is marked by some positive developments including a renewed drive for reforms, one of which is the return to the ballot box in key countries recovering from the consequences of the Arab spring. More governments are realizing the need for strengthening electoral systems and the ramifications that will follow a potential disregard of public demands for reform. Electoral processes remain at the essence of any democratic shift where societal changes will be part of the political agenda in any transitioning system. This intervention Regional Electoral Support Phase II 2017-2021 builds on Phase I (2014-2016) supported by Sida previously. UNDP, through this contribution, works with all concerned authorities that manage elections in the region as well as civil society, media, League of Arab States and other national and international stakeholders during 2017-2021 to implement this project. The overall goal of the intervention is to build and expand on the achievements of Phase I with the overall aim to improve accountability, participation and representation. The Global Project for Electoral Cycle Support (GPECS) Regional Component Phase II aims to contribute towards enhancing knowledge, awareness and capacity on electoral processes and regional cooperation among electoral stakeholders. The project constitutes of four main outcome objectives to be achieved by the end of the project: 1. Regional electoral capacity and knowledge enhanced; 2. Profession of electoral administration strengthened through regional cooperation; 3. Civic and political participation of women enhanced; 4. Role of youth in the electoral cycle promoted.
Democratic governance project, expanding on results achieved through electoral assistance support in MENA during Phase I.

UNDP har inkommit till Sida med förslag om stöd uppgående till totalt 65,8 MSEK för ett regionalt valcykelstödsprojekt för Mellanöstern och Nordafrika fas II för perioden 2017-2020. MENA-regionen kännetecknas ofta av bristande demokrati och lågt politiskt deltagande, särskilt bland ungdomar och kvinnor som utgör en utmaning för regionen. Det finns ofta behov av i MENA-regionen ökad kunskap om övergången till demokrati och internationellt accepterade valpraxis. Det övergripande målet och de förväntade effekterna av projektet är: "Medborgarnas förväntningar på röst, utveckling, rättsstatsprincipen och ansvarsutkrävande möts av starkare system för demokratiskt styre".
Insatsen har fyra resultatmål som ska uppnås i slutet av insatsen: 1) Stärkt regional valkapacitet och kunskap, 2) Stärkt professionalism inom valkommissioner genom regionalt samarbete, 3) Ökat kvinnligt deltagande i politiskt beslutsfattande och processer och 4) Främjande av ungdomars roll i hela valrörelsen. Målen förväntas uppnås genom b.la. utbildningsaktiviteter, seminarier, Syd-Syd samarbete, partnerskap med regionala nätverk inom media, partnerskap med andra regionala organisationer och samråd i valfrågor med landspecifika valmyndigheter.
Insatsen innebär i hög grad erfarenhetsutbyte och utbildningsaktiviteter. Ingen vidareförmedling kommer ske till nationella projekt eller partners. Projektet utgör en komponent av ett globalt projekt för valcykelstöd, Global Project for Electoral Cycle Support (GPECS). GPECS får stöd av Sida inom ramen för stöd från multilateralt samarbete. För denna insats är Sida ensam givare. UNDP kommer inte heller ge något direktstöd till den regionala organisationen för valkommissioner (Organization for Arab Electoral Management Bodies, ArabEMBs) utan ges i form av tekniskt stöd.
Sida finansierade den första fasen av programmet (2013-2016) och bedömningen är att resultaten av programmet var goda. Programmet utvärderades 2015 med slutsatsen att projektet på ett övertygande och konsekvent sätt hade uppnått målen. Projektet bedömdes ha skapat ett nära samarbete med Arabförbundet (Leage of Arab States) och stärkt dess kompetens och resurser för valfrågor. Det viktigaste resultatet bedöms vara etablerande av en regional organisation för valkommissioner. Projektet bedöms ha bidragit till ökad kunskap om valrelaterade frågor genom erfarenhetsutbyte och kapacitetsutveckling.

title.narrative: Decision on Amendment of Contribution - UNDP Electoral Support (52030288) signed

description.narrative: The fourth reporting period of the second phase of the project covers the implementation period June 2019 – June 2020 and recognizes to hold the high relevance to the MENA context; the MENA region is a home to a diverse set of countries, systems and democratic challenges. Following are some example of the achieved results during the reporting period: 1) Promoted Inclusive Political Processes The project’s advocacy on youth participation resulted in the formal decision taken at the 4th general assembly of the Organization of ArabEMBs to establish a regional network for youth in elections that creates space for youth in electoral processes and decision-making. The network would be the first of its kind among EMBs and aims to bridge the gap between decision makers and the youth in the region. During the reporting period, the project, together with ArabEMBs established a working group made up of EMB and CSO representatives to define the framework and function of the network. The project in close collaboration with the youth team at UNDP implemented the fifth edition of the Youth Leadership Programme (YLP5), reaching more than 13,000 participants in 11 countries through workshops, SDG camps and national activities delivered by 76 youth - serving organizations and supported in its five successful cycles until the end of 2019 around 7,000 projects. These efforts culminated with the 5th YLP at a regional forum held in Amman, Jordan on November 2020 which focused on the theme of civic engagement. 2) Strengthened Regional Bodies The project continued its support to the regional Organization of Arab Electoral Management Bodies (ArabEMBs). During the reporting period, the ArabEMBs opened offices as its first official headquarters building in Amman, Jordan. The physical location allows the organization to centralize its work as well as host its secretariat offices and operational capacities. besides that, the Organization, for the first time since its establishment, received memberships fees from member EMBs in Palestine, Lebanon, Libya, Jordan and Mauritania, initiating the first independently sourced financial contributions and allowing the organization to become financially established. Alongside the 4th GA, the Organization held its annual regional conference aimed at sharing knowledge and expertise and promoting dialogue on elections in the region. The conference, attended by both member and non-member of ArabEMBs as well as international organizations working in the field of elections, was on the role of media in promoting inclusive and credible electoral processes. Dialogue on the topic of social media and elections was initiated in the region for the first time, and resulted in a set of recommendations to EMBs on cooperation with the media sector, the role of advocacy and awareness raising in the media, the fight against the spread of disinformation and hate speech online and the role of media in monitoring elections. 3) Country Support During the reporting period, the project provided technical and advisory support to Tunisia, Iraq, Lebanon, Libya, Sudan, Djibouti and Jordan. The project provided technical support to the electoral assistance projects in Libya and Tunisia, provided advisory support to the electoral assistance project in Lebanon, and led by the UN’s electoral assistance division, assisted in the assessment of electoral needs in Sudan, Djibouti, Jordan and Iraq. Support to Partners during COVID-19 The coronavirus outbreak had social and economic effects on repercussions on democracies across the globe. Election management bodies and public authorities around the world have had to make decisions regarding whether and how to hold scheduled electoral activities (e.g., voter registration, political campaigning, poll worker training, and ballot casting). As a response, the project rapidly developed its offer to EMBs and other stakeholders involved in elections. The offer translates through specific packages of support framed around two types of situations identified: - Immediate: countries going ahead with elections as scheduled during COVID-19 pandemic; and, - short/medium-term: countries looking to postpone elections. Developed jointly with global electoral experts, the offer includes support related to: - Assessment of Covid-19 impact on electoral operations and formulation or update of electoral support projects and activities in the Covid-19 context; - Technical/advisory support to national stakeholders: direct support on the implementation of electoral operations and their organization/postponement in a Covid-19 context; - Development of protocols for specific electoral operations in a Covid-19 context and procurement challenges for production and delivery of sensitive electoral material; - Coordination with UN DPPA/EAD and other UN agencies in the delivery of electoral assistance; and - Support initiatives for monitoring and mitigation of election-related violence
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
